description: Flambards in Cornwall closed in November 2024 due to a decrease in visitor numbers.
title: Chance to bid for Flambards' Concorde replica and WW2 jeep
title_page: Chance to bid for Flambards' Concorde replica and WW2 jeep - BBC News
maintext:
A full-size replica of the front a Concorde aircraft is just one of the items up for auction after the closure of a theme park in Cornwall last year.
Flambards in Helston closed in November 2024 due to a decrease in visitor numbers and a rise in running costs, its bosses said.
In total, 2,200 lots will be up for sale in March, including a Victorian fire engine and a US Army wartime jeep.
Ian Cunningham, the owner of Flambards, said it was a "great disappointment to break up the collection" but it was "inevitable".
The site was opened under the name Cornwall Aero Park in 1976 by James Kingsford-Hale.
Mr Kingsford-Hale's wife Audrey then created a model Victorian village at the park in the 1970s and 1980s, which included a butcher's shop, a chemist and a bootmaker.
The shops will also be sold off in the auction, as well as model planes and other memorabilia.
